title_en: Titanium nanoparticles provoke ferritinophagy-mediated ferroptosis via inhibition of the Nrf2-HO-1 signaling pathway in osteocytes.
abstract_en: Wear particles-induced osteolysis is the primary cause of aseptic loosening and subsequent joint replacement failure. Osteocytes, the most abundant cells in bone, are in direct contact with implants; however, the interaction between osteocytes and wear particles remains largely unelucidated. In the present study, in vivo results showed that titanium (Ti) nanoparticles (with diameters of 40 nm and 800 nm) markedly triggered bone destruction and increased osteocytes death, and this effect was mitigated by the ferroptosis inhibitor ferrostatin-1 (Fer-1). Our in vitro experiments revealed that Ti nanoparticles significantly inhibited the viability of osteocytes MLO-Y4, and induced cell death. Meanwhile, Ti nanoparticles remarkably promoted ferroptosis in MLO-Y4 cells, as evidenced by iron overload, lipid peroxidation accumulation, downregulated protein expressions of solute carrier family 7 member 11 (SLC7A11) and glutathione peroxidase 4 (GPX4), and glutathione (GSH) depletion. Notably, this ferroptotic response was associated with enhanced ferritinophagy and degradation of ferritin heavy chain 1 (FTH1), since inhibition of ferritinophagy with 3-methyladenine (3-MA) alleviated Ti nanoparticles-induced ferroptosis. Additionally, Ti nanoparticles significantly suppressed the erythroid 2-related factor 2 (Nrf2)/ heme oxygenase-1(HO-1) pathway; the Nrf2-specific activator sulforaphane (SFN) reversed Ti nanoparticles-induced Fe²⁺ accumulation and lipid peroxidation, attenuated ferroptosis and ferritinophagy, and thereby restored the viability of MLO-Y4 cells. Collectively, these findings identify ferritinophagy-mediated ferroptosis as a novel mechanism underlying Ti nanoparticles-induced osteocytes death, and demonstrate that the Nrf2/HO-1 pathway is essential for regulating Ti nanoparticles-induced ferritinophagy and ferroptosis. These results further suggest that targeting the Nrf2/HO-1pathway may represent a promising therapeutic strategy for preventing or alleviating ferritinophagy-mediated ferroptosis in wear particles-related osteoclastogenesis and periprosthetic osteolysis.
explanation_zh:
這項研究主要探討了穿戴材料的微小顆粒（特別是鈦顆粒）對骨細胞（即骨骼中的主要細胞）的影響，這些顆粒可能導致關節置換手術失敗。研究發現，這些鈦顆粒會引起骨骼破壞和骨細胞死亡，但使用一種名為ferrostatin-1的抑制劑可以減輕這種影響。

研究方法包括在實驗室內外進行測試，結果顯示鈦顆粒會抑制骨細胞的生存，並促進一種叫做「鐵死亡」的細胞死亡方式。這種過程涉及鐵的積聚和細胞內抗氧化物質的耗竭。研究還發現，某些信號通路（如Nrf2/HO-1）對這一過程至關重要，並且可以通過特定的激活劑來改善細胞的存活率。

對一般人來說，這項研究的意義在於，它揭示了鈦顆粒可能如何影響骨骼健康，並提供了一個新的治療方向，可能有助於預防與關節置換相關的骨骼問題。這就像是找到了一把鑰匙，能幫助我們更好地理解和對抗因為穿戴材料而引起的骨骼損傷。

title_en: BolMYB28-BolMAM1 Confers Salt and Drought Tolerance via Regulating Specific Aliphatic Glucosinolate Biosynthesis and Affecting ABA Accumulation in Broccoli.
abstract_en: Glucosinolates (GSLs) are secondary metabolites popularly existing in Brassicaceae. However, the role and regulation of GSLs in environmental stress response remain ambiguous. Here, Methylthioalkylmalate synthase 1 (BolMAM1), a GSL biosynthesis-associated gene, was identified in broccoli. The overexpression of BolMAM1 enhanced both salt and drought tolerance in broccoli, along with an increase in aliphatic GSLs, such as 2(R)-hydroxy-3-butenyl GSL (progoitrin). Progoitrin could induce ABA accumulation in vitro. Consistently, ABA homoeostasis was modulated to accumulate more ABA in OEX-BolMAM1 transgenic broccoli. Moreover, sulforaphane (SFN), one of the hydrolysates of aliphatic GSLs, also exhibited accelerated accumulation in OEX-BolMAM1 transgenic broccoli. External application of SFN could rapidly induce stomatal closure. Furthermore, BolMYB28 was demonstrated to directly bind to the promoter of BolMAM1 and activate its transcription. These results indicated that BolMYB28-BolMAM1 confers tolerance to salt and drought stresses mainly by accelerating the biosynthesis of certain specific aliphatic GSLs. Progoitrin is a newly reported GSL positively regulating ABA accumulation. SFN may act as a signaling molecule to regulate stomatal behavior. These findings reveal the role of BolMYB28-BolMAM1 in abiotic stress response via regulating aliphatic GSL biosynthesis, and suggest the applications of progoitrin and SFN as natural defence factors to resist abiotic stresses in plants.
explanation_zh:
這項研究主要探討了在環境壓力下，甘藍科植物（如西蘭花）中一種名為「葡萄糖苷（GSL）」的次級代謝物的作用及其調控機制。研究者發現了一個與GSL合成相關的基因——BolMAM1，並通過提升這個基因的表現，發現西蘭花在鹽和乾旱的環境中能夠更好地生存。

研究方法上，科學家對轉基因西蘭花進行了實驗，觀察其在不同環境壓力下的表現。結果顯示，BolMAM1的過度表現不僅提高了西蘭花的鹽和乾旱耐受性，還促進了某些特定GSL的合成，如progoitrin，這種物質能促進植物內部一種叫ABA的激素的積累。

對一般人來說，這項研究的意義在於，它揭示了如何利用自然的植物成分來提高作物對環境壓力的抵抗力。這不僅有助於農業生產的穩定，也可能讓我們在未來享受到更健康的蔬菜，因為這些天然物質可能有助於植物的生長和健康。簡單來說，這就像是給植物裝上一個「防護罩」，讓它們在艱難的環境中也能茁壯成長。

title_en: Deciphering the quantitative relationship between NRF2 and SRXN1 through semi-mechanistic computational modeling.
abstract_en: Nuclear factor erythroid 2-related factor 2 (NRF2) plays a vital role in the regulation of various antioxidant response element (ARE) genes, which control physiological processes such as oxidative stress, autophagy, proliferation and apoptosis to maintain cellular homeostasis. It is not understood in detail how the NRF2 program acquires its flexibility with respect to regulation of its downstream targets. Various NRF2 binding partners and cofactors specific to ARE genes are involved in this regulation, and are potentially condition-specific (e.g., type of stressor) and dependent on non-canonical signaling pathways (i.e., crosstalk). Here, we explored the quantitative relationship between NRF2 and sulfiredoxin 1 (SRXN1), a bona fide key NRF2 target gene. We developed a semi-mechanistic mathematical model based on time course experimental data of NRF2 and SRXN1 protein expression in HepG2 cells following single or repeated exposure to NRF2 activating soft electrophiles (sulforaphane, andrographolide, ethacrynic acid or CDDO-me) at a wide concentration range. We showed that a nonlinear mixed effect modeling approach with partially hierarchical parameters accurately captures the observed experimental dynamics. Our analysis highlights that NRF2 requires a cofactor or post-translational modification to regulate its activity as a transcription factor. Moreover, this modulation of the transcription factor activity of NRF2 is time-, compound- and exposure scenario specific. We conclude that a complete understanding of NRF2-mediated ARE genes activation requires detailed dynamic information on NRF2 binding partners and cofactors.
explanation_zh:
這項研究主要探討了「核因子紅細胞2相關因子2」（NRF2）在調控抗氧化反應基因方面的角色，特別是它如何影響細胞的生理過程，如氧化壓力、自噬、增殖和細胞死亡。研究對象是人類肝癌細胞（HepG2），透過數學模型分析NRF2與其目標基因「硫氧還原酶1」（SRXN1）之間的關係。

研究方法是使用不同濃度的NRF2激活物（如硫代葡萄糖素等），觀察NRF2和SRXN1蛋白的表現變化。結果顯示，NRF2的活性受到多種因素的影響，包括需要特定的輔因子或後轉譯修飾，並且這種調控是時間和情境特定的。

對於一般人來說，這項研究可能有助於我們理解如何透過飲食或環境中的某些化合物來激活NRF2，進而提升身體的抗氧化能力，這對於預防疾病和維持健康都有潛在的意義。簡單來說，了解NRF2的運作方式，可能幫助我們選擇更有益健康的食物或生活方式。

title_en: The effect of graphene oxide-polyethylene glycol on lung cell and treatment of sulforaphane.
abstract_en: This study explores the cytotoxic and biochemical effects of PEGylated graphene oxide (GO-PEG) nanoparticles, sulforaphane, and Raphanus sativus L. (black radish) juice on BEAS-2B human bronchial epithelial cells. Sulforaphane was extracted from radish juice through pH-adjusted aqueous treatment followed by organic solvent extraction, and quantified via high-performance liquid chromatography (HPLC) at 202 nm, with a retention time of 11.0 min. GO-PEG nanoparticles produced from graphites (50 nm and 400 nm) were tested at concentrations ranging from 50-225 μg mL<sup>-1</sup> and 100-1000 μg mL<sup>-1</sup> to have IC<sub>50</sub> values, respectively. Sulforaphane and black radish juice were also administered. The MTT assay revealed IC<sub>50</sub> values of 8.7 μg mL<sup>-1</sup> for sulforaphane, 197.0 mg mL<sup>-1</sup> for black radish juice, 175.8 μg mL<sup>-1</sup> for GO-PEG (50 nm), and 650.6 μg mL<sup>-1</sup> for GO-PEG (400 nm). Biochemical analyses showed that sulforaphane and radish juice decreased IL-6 levels and increased antioxidant enzyme activities (GSH-Px and CAT). These results highlight the therapeutic potential of GO-PEG, sulforaphane, and black radish juice for anti-inflammatory and antioxidant applications.
explanation_zh:
這項研究主要探討了PEG化石墨烯氧化物（GO-PEG）奈米粒子、硫代葡萄糖素（sulforaphane）和黑蘿蔔汁對人類支氣管上皮細胞的細胞毒性和生化效應。研究人員從黑蘿蔔汁中提取硫代葡萄糖素，並使用高效液相色譜法進行定量分析。

在實驗中，他們測試了不同濃度的GO-PEG奈米粒子和硫代葡萄糖素的細胞毒性，發現硫代葡萄糖素的IC50值（即能抑制50%細胞生長的濃度）為8.7微克每毫升，顯示其具有較強的細胞抑制效果。此外，黑蘿蔔汁和GO-PEG奈米粒子的IC50值也被測定，並且研究還發現這些物質能降低促炎因子IL-6的水平，並提高抗氧化酶的活性。

這些結果顯示，GO-PEG、硫代葡萄糖素和黑蘿蔔汁可能在抗炎和抗氧化方面具有潛在的治療效果。對於一般人來說，這意味著適量攝取黑蘿蔔或含有硫代葡萄糖素的食物，可能有助於改善身體的抗炎能力，進而促進健康。就像在日常生活中，我們選擇吃一些有益的食物來增強免疫力一樣，這些研究結果也提供了新的飲食啟示。

title_en: Design, synthesis and biological evaluation of magnolol-sulforaphane hybrid analogues as potential therapeutics of triple-negative breast cancer.
abstract_en: Triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) is an aggressive subtype that primarily relies on chemotherapy. Natural products like magnolol and sulforaphane, especially their synthetic hybrid, have shown promising antitumor activity. To develop more potent agents, we designed and synthesized 15 novel magnolol-sulforaphane hybrid analogues and evaluated their anticancer efficacy. Among them, compound 17a demonstrated the highest potency, exhibiting an average 7.4-fold increase in antiproliferative activity with IC<sub>50</sub> values ranging from 0.85 ± 0.04 μM to 1.34 ± 0.02 μM in TNBC cell lines compared to the parent hybrid CT1-3. In vitro, 17a significantly suppressed TNBC cell proliferation, colony formation, migration, and invasion while inducing apoptosis. In vivo, administration of 17a effectively inhibited tumor growth without apparent toxicity in an MDA-MB-231 xenograft model, as evidenced by normal organ morphology. Mechanistically, RNA sequencing revealed that 17a downregulated the nucleotide excision repair (NER) and NF-κB pathways, suppressing expression of NER-related genes (ERCC2, POLE2, LIG1, GTF2H3, and DDB2) at mRNA and protein levels and inhibiting phosphorylation of IKKα and p65. These findings position 17a as a potent therapeutic candidate for TNBC treatment, warranting further clinical investigation.
explanation_zh:
這項研究主要針對三陰性乳腺癌（TNBC），這是一種特別侵略性的癌症類型，通常需要依賴化療來治療。研究團隊設計並合成了15種新型的木蘭醇-硫佛啶混合物，並評估它們的抗癌效果。

在實驗中，發現其中一種化合物17a的抗癌效果最為顯著，對TNBC細胞的增殖抑制能力比原本的混合物提高了約7.4倍，顯示出非常低的抑制濃度。此外，17a不僅能有效抑制癌細胞的增長、形成和擴散，還能促使癌細胞死亡。在動物實驗中，17a也能有效抑制腫瘤生長，且沒有明顯的毒性影響。

這些結果顯示，17a可能成為治療三陰性乳腺癌的一個有力候選藥物，未來需要進一步的臨床研究來驗證其效果。對於一般人來說，這項研究提供了希望，顯示出天然成分的結合可能在癌症治療上帶來新的突破，讓我們對未來的癌症治療充滿期待。

title_en: Enhancing myocardial injury recovery: Nrf2 activation by sulforaphane regulates ferroptosis and oxidative stress in takotsubo-like models.
abstract_en: Takotsubo syndrome (TTS), once considered benign, can cause life-threatening myocardial injury. Although oxidative stress and ferroptosis are implicated in its pathogenesis, targeted therapies are not available for TTS. We demonstrate that sulforaphane (SFN), a natural Nrf2 activator, mitigates TTS-related injury in isoproterenol-induced rat models and AC16 cardiomyocytes. Isoproterenol induced ferroptosis and oxidative stress by impairing Nrf2 signaling. SFN treatment restored myocardial structure and function while enhancing antioxidant capacity, reducing mitochondrial damage, and suppressing ferroptosis markers. Additionally, similar to Fer-1 (a ferroptosis inhibitor), SFN reduced intracellular ferrous levels but uniquely activated Nrf2-driven endogenous defenses. Notably, Nrf2 inhibition abrogated the benefits of SFN in both in vitro and in vivo experiments. These findings highlight SFN as a dual-action therapeutic for TTS, simultaneously targeting oxidative stress and ferroptosis via Nrf2 activation. The therapeutic efficacy of SFN, combined with endogenous pathway modulation, underscores its translational potential for improving TTS outcomes.
explanation_zh:
這項研究主要探討的是「章魚心症候群」（Takotsubo syndrome, TTS），這是一種可能導致心臟受傷的疾病，雖然之前被認為是良性的。研究的對象是老鼠模型和心臟細胞，目的是了解一種天然化合物——硫代葡萄糖素（sulforaphane, SFN）對於TTS的影響。

研究方法是使用異丙腎上腺素來誘導心臟受損，然後觀察SFN的治療效果。結果顯示，SFN能夠改善心臟結構和功能，增強抗氧化能力，減少線粒體損傷，並抑制與細胞死亡相關的標記物。特別的是，SFN還能激活身體內部的防禦機制，這是其獨特的優勢。

對一般人來說，這項研究的意義在於，SFN可能成為一種新型的治療選擇，有助於減少心臟病的風險，特別是對於那些有TTS風險的人。這就像是為心臟提供了一層額外的保護，幫助它抵抗壓力和損傷，讓我們的心臟更健康。

title_en: Metabolomics and Transcriptomics Analyses Reveal the Mechanisms of Sulforaphane Conversion and Adaptive Strategies in the Absence of Glucose by Lactiplantibacillus plantarum.
abstract_en: Sulforaphane is a beneficial but unstable bioactive compound that can be converted from glucoraphanin by Lactiplantibacillus plantarum. However, the sulforaphane conversion rate is low, and the conversion mechanism of L. plantarum remains unclear. This research utilized the adaptive laboratory evolution technology to enhance the sulforaphane conversion rate of L. plantarum. The results showed that an increase in the glucose replacement ratio significantly downregulated carbohydrate metabolism and upregulated amino acid metabolism. Transcriptomic analysis showed that the ALE-adapted strain significantly upregulated carbohydrate metabolism and amino acid metabolism. In the conversion pathway, glucoraphanin is imported into L. plantarum cells, and its glucose moiety is phosphorylated by bglF (the phosphate group may be derived from phosphoenolpyruvate via the phosphotransferase system). Subsequently, the S-glycosidic bond of phosphorylated glucoraphanin is hydrolyzed by bglA (6-phospho-β-glucosidase), followed by nonenzymatic rearrangement and sulfate elimination, ultimately yielding sulforaphane. This research can contribute to revealing the interaction mechanism between microorganisms and natural active substances.
explanation_zh:
這項研究主要探討了一種名為硫代葡萄糖素（sulforaphane）的有益化合物，這種化合物可以從另一種物質——葡萄糖苷（glucoraphanin）中轉化而來，而這一過程是由一種名為乳酸桿菌（Lactiplantibacillus plantarum）進行的。不過，這種轉化的效率不高，且轉化的具體機制尚不清楚。

研究者使用了一種叫做適應性實驗室進化（adaptive laboratory evolution, ALE）的技術，來提高乳酸桿菌的轉化率。結果顯示，當細菌的葡萄糖替代比率提高時，碳水化合物的代謝降低，而氨基酸的代謝則上升。這意味著細菌在處理這些物質時，會有不同的反應。

這項研究的意義在於，了解微生物如何與天然活性物質互動，可能有助於未來開發出更有效的健康食品或補充劑，讓我們更容易攝取到這些對健康有益的化合物。就像是優化一個食譜，讓我們能更好地享用美味又健康的菜餚。

title_en: Sulforaphane attenuates oxidative stress, senescence, and ferroptosis induced by cigarette smoke extract in vitro and in vivo via upregulating the expression of SIRT1.
abstract_en: Cigarette smoking induces lung toxicity by triggering oxidative stress, leading to apoptosis, ferroptosis, and senescence. Sulforaphane (SFN), a potent antioxidant, activates the SIRT1 pathway, enhancing cellular stress resistance and survival. This study aimed to evaluate the protective effects of SFN against cigarette smoke extract (CSE)-induced damage in human airway epithelial cells (BEAS-2B) and in mouse lungs, focusing on its role in upregulating SIRT1 expression. BEAS-2B cells were treated with CSE and SFN, and cell viability was assessed using the MTT assay. Cellular senescence was assessed using the SA-β-gal assay and the expression of genes associated with senescence (p16 and p21). The expression levels of SIRT1, senescence-associated secretory phenotype (SASP) cytokines (IL-1β, IL-6, IL-8, TNF-α), GPX4, and SLC7A11 were quantified using qRT-PCR. Additionally, ROS production, GSH and MDA levels, and iron content were measured. An emphysema mouse model was induced by intraperitoneal administration of CSE (7.2 mg/kg) alone or in combination with SFN (10.2 mg/kg) over 28 days, and subsequent histopathological changes were evaluated. Our findings revealed that SFN co-treatment effectively mitigated CSE-induced cytotoxicity, senescence, and SASP cytokine secretion, as well as the pronounced emphysematous changes in lung tissues. Furthermore, SFN reversed CSE-induced downregulation of SIRT1 and upregulation of NF-κB. Notably, SFN also inhibited CSE-induced ferroptosis by increasing GPX4 and SLC7A11 expression while reducing iron and MDA levels. The findings of the present study demonstrated that sulforaphane offers protective effects against CSE-induced toxicity by mitigating oxidative stress, ferroptosis, and cellular senescence.
explanation_zh:
這項研究主要探討了硫代葡萄糖素（SFN）對香煙煙霧引起的肺部損傷的保護作用。研究對象是人類氣道上皮細胞和小鼠肺部，目的是了解SFN如何提高細胞的抗壓能力，特別是透過提升SIRT1這個蛋白的表達。

研究方法方面，科學家們將BEAS-2B細胞暴露於香煙煙霧提取物（CSE）和SFN，並使用各種測試來評估細胞的存活率、老化情況以及與老化相關的基因表達。對小鼠模型則是注射CSE和SFN，觀察肺部的變化。

研究結果顯示，SFN能有效減少CSE引起的細胞毒性、老化和炎症反應，並改善小鼠肺部的病理變化。此外，SFN還能逆轉CSE對SIRT1的抑制作用，並減少與鐵相關的細胞死亡。

對一般人來說，這項研究提示我們，攝取富含硫代葡萄糖素的食物（如十字花科蔬菜）可能有助於減少香煙煙霧對肺部的傷害，並且可能在某種程度上有助於保護肺部健康，特別是對於吸煙者或二手煙暴露者。這就像在面對強烈陽光時，穿上防曬衣物一樣，能提供一定的保護。

title_en: Integrative Network Pharmacology and Proteomics Decipher the Immunomodulatory Mechanism of Sulforaphane Against Intrinsic Skin Aging.
abstract_en: Skin aging is characterized by declines in structural functions, contributing to age-associated frailty. Sulforaphane (SFN), a natural anti-inflammatory substance, has been widely applied in multiple types of cancer therapies. However, its role in alleviating intrinsic skin aging remains to be elucidated. Integrative network pharmacology and proteomics were utilized to investigate the underlying mechanisms of SFN in intrinsic skin aging. Fifty-one anti-aging targets of SFN were identified, highlighting its promising regulatory impact on the aging process. Based on an 18-month-old natural aging mouse model, significant alleviation in skin structure, redox homeostasis, and immune cell composition was noted after 2 months of SFN supplementation. Additionally, proteomic analysis demonstrated that SFN reversed the proteomic profile of intrinsic skin aging, with 233 differentially expressed proteins (DEPs) identified in SFN-fed aging mice. Of note, the up-regulated DEPs were highly enriched in the apelin signaling pathway (p = 0.010). Furthermore, immune cell infiltration and whole blood cell analysis revealed that SFN rescued T cells depletion in dermal tissue, which was strongly correlated with DEPs enriched in the SFN-activated apelin signaling pathway. SFN improves skin morphology and immune functions via activating the apelin signaling pathway, suggesting new prime targets in counteracting intrinsic skin aging.
explanation_zh:
這項研究主要探討了硫代葡萄糖素（SFN）對皮膚老化的影響，特別是它如何改善內在的皮膚老化問題。研究對象是年齡約18個月的老鼠，這個年齡相當於人類的中老年。研究方法結合了網絡藥理學和蛋白質組學，來分析SFN的作用機制。

研究結果顯示，SFN能顯著改善老鼠的皮膚結構、氧化還原平衡及免疫細胞組成。經過兩個月的SFN補充，老鼠的皮膚狀況有明顯改善，並且在蛋白質組學分析中發現233種與皮膚老化相關的蛋白質表達發生變化。特別是，SFN能激活一條名為apelin信號通路的路徑，這對改善皮膚的形態和免疫功能有重要作用。

對一般人來說，這項研究提示我們，某些天然物質如SFN可能對延緩皮膚老化有潛在的幫助，這或許能成為未來抗老化產品的研究方向。不過，仍需更多的研究來確認其在人體上的效果，切勿過度期待。
